visualization_prompt: Generate a spline chart showing monthly renewable energy production trends over two years using synthetic time-series data with seasonal adjustment
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two time-series with 14 monthly observations each (January 2023-February 2024). Solar data (μ=5342, σ=1009) shows seasonal peaks in summer months, while wind data (μ=6021, σ=636) demonstrates a steady increasing trend. Synthetic values maintain domain validity through reference to EIA historical ranges and incorporate realistic seasonality patterns. The spline chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating markers and focusing on trend lines, aligning with Tufte's principles. Color choices (#FFC107=yellow for solar, #2196F3=blue for wind) apply Cairo's preattentive processing for immediate categorical distinction. Responsive legend repositioning maintains readability across viewports, while D3-style axis labeling (e.g., 'Megawatt Hours') ensures quantitative clarity.
